Description: Upper section of a painted limestone shabti of Wehemdjedut (?) with an incised striated black lappet-wig, a carved brown face with black and white eyes, a black, red and yellow face, parallel brown hands in relief holding red hoes, the legs are inscribed with part of Chapter 6 of The Book of The Dead in a central back column, one partially surviving and two surviving rows of black painted Hieroglyphs on a yellow ground, the back is decorated with a representation of a red seed-basket and relief representations of two red nw-pots hanging down the back of each arm.
